news_header: Kemira reported a turnover increase in Q4, but operating margin decreased due to maintenance stoppages. The Board proposed a dividend of EUR 0.74 per share.
news_original_title: Kemiran kannattavuuteen kolhu– Osinko nousee yli odotusten
news_text: Kemira published its financial results for Q4, showing a turnover of EUR 723.7 million, up from EUR 690.2 million year-on-year. However, the operating margin fell to EUR 135.0 million from EUR 149.3 million due to maintenance stoppages. The Board proposed a dividend of EUR 0.74 per share, slightly higher than last year's EUR 0.68. The company anticipates a turnover of EUR 2.8-3.2 billion for the year ahead, with expected growth in the water treatment market and recovery in pulp and packaging sectors.
